title: 2 Peter Chapter 3 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Peter chapter 3 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Peter Chapter 3 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Peter Chapter 3.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 3:3, who shall come in the last days?
options: Scoffers walking after their own lusts
questions.correctAnswer: Scoffers walking after their own lusts
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:3 states that in the last days scoffers shall come, walking after their own lusts.

questions.question: What question do the scoffers ask according to 2 Peter 3:4?
options: Where is the promise of his coming?
What is the meaning of life?
questions.correctAnswer: Where is the promise of his coming?
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:4 shows scoffers saying, 'Where is the promise of his coming?'

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 3:5, what were the heavens and earth created by?
questions.correctAnswer: The word of God
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:5 states that by the word of God the heavens were of old, and the earth standing out of the water and in the water.

questions.question: What happened to the world that then was, according to 2 Peter 3:6?
options: It was overflowed with water and perished
questions.correctAnswer: It was overflowed with water and perished
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:6 says the world that then was, being overflowed with water, perished.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 3:7, what is reserved unto fire against the day of judgment?
options: The heavens and the earth which are now
questions.correctAnswer: The heavens and the earth which are now
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:7 states the heavens and the earth, which are now, are kept in store, reserved unto fire against the day of judgment and perdition of ungodly men.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 3:8, how does the Lord regard a day?
options: One day is with the Lord as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day
One day is longer than a thousand years
One day is exactly twenty-four hours
One day is three thousand years
questions.correctAnswer: One day is with the Lord as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:8 explains that one day is with the Lord as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day.

questions.question: What is the Lord's attitude toward His promise according to 2 Peter 3:9?
options: He is longsuffering, not willing that any should perish
questions.correctAnswer: He is longsuffering, not willing that any should perish
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:9 states the Lord is longsuffering to us-ward, not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to repentance.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 3:10, how will the day of the Lord come?
options: As a thief in the night
questions.correctAnswer: As a thief in the night
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:10 says the day of the Lord will come as a thief in the night.

questions.question: What will happen to the elements on the day of the Lord according to 2 Peter 3:10?
options: They shall melt with fervent heat
questions.correctAnswer: They shall melt with fervent heat
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:10 states the elements shall melt with fervent heat on that day.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 3:13, what do we look for based on God's promise?
options: New heavens and a new earth
questions.correctAnswer: New heavens and a new earth
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:13 tells us we look for new heavens and a new earth, wherein dwelleth righteousness.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Peter 3:16 says Paul's epistles contain some things hard to be understood.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:16 acknowledges that Paul's epistles include some things hard to be understood.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Peter 3:17, believers should beware lest they fall from their own steadfastness.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:17 warns believers to beware lest they also fall from their own steadfastness.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Peter 3:18 encourages growth in the knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:18 instructs believers to grow in grace and in the knowledge of Jesus Christ.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 2 Peter 3:14: 'Wherefore, beloved, seeing that ye look for such things, be diligent that ye may be found of him in ______, without spot, and blameless.'
questions.correctAnswer: peace
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:14 says be diligent that ye may be found of him in peace, without spot, and blameless.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 3:1, what is the purpose of writing this second epistle?
options: To stir up your pure minds by way of remembrance
To give new laws to follow
questions.correctAnswer: To stir up your pure minds by way of remembrance
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:1 explains the epistle is written to stir up the pure minds of the readers by way of remembrance.

medium.title: 2 Peter Chapter 3 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Peter Chapter 3 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with doubt about Christ’s return. Based on 2 Peter 3, what biblical truth would you share about God's timing?
options: One day with the Lord is as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day
God is slow because He has forgotten His promise
The promise of Christ's return is no longer valid
We should not expect Christ to return anytime soon
questions.correctAnswer: One day with the Lord is as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:8 teaches that God’s timing is different from human timing, reminding us not to doubt His promise. Verses 9 and 15 also emphasize that God is longsuffering, not willing that any should perish.

questions.question: How does 2 Peter 3 instruct believers to live in light of the coming day of the Lord?
options: Ignoring the future and focusing on the present
questions.correctAnswer: In holy conversation and godliness
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:11 urges believers to live holy and godly lives because the present heavens and earth will be dissolved. This is supported by verses 12 and 14, which call for diligence and peace.

questions.question: A believer is feeling discouraged by scoffers mocking the promise of Christ's return. According to 2 Peter 3, what is true about these scoffers?
options: They walk after their own lusts
questions.correctAnswer: They walk after their own lusts
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:3 describes scoffers in the last days as walking after their own lusts, showing selfishness rather than faithfulness. This contrasts with the call to repentance in verses 9 and 15.

questions.question: What does 2 Peter 3 teach about the Lord's patience towards sinners?
options: The Lord is longsuffering, not willing that any should perish but that all should come to repentance
The Lord delays judgment because He is indifferent
The Lord has forgotten His promise
The Lord punishes immediately without warning
questions.correctAnswer: The Lord is longsuffering, not willing that any should perish but that all should come to repentance
questions.explanation: Verse 9 explains God's longsuffering nature and His desire for all to repent rather than perish, encouraging believers to share the Gospel patiently.

questions.question: How does 2 Peter 3 describe the day of the Lord?
options: It will come as a thief in the night, with the heavens passing away and the earth being burned up
It will be a quiet, unnoticed event
It will happen only after many generations
It will be a gradual process over many years
questions.correctAnswer: It will come as a thief in the night, with the heavens passing away and the earth being burned up
questions.explanation: Verse 10 vividly describes the suddenness and dramatic nature of the Lord’s day, emphasizing the need for readiness and holy living as per verses 11 and 12.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 3, what hope should believers hold onto despite the dissolution of the present heavens and earth?
options: The promise of new heavens and a new earth where righteousness dwells
That everything will remain as it is forever
That the earth will be destroyed with no replacement
That only the righteous will escape this world
questions.correctAnswer: The promise of new heavens and a new earth where righteousness dwells
questions.explanation: Verse 13 gives believers hope in a future new creation characterized by righteousness, encouraging perseverance and godly living.

questions.question: How does the passage in 2 Peter 3 encourage believers to prepare for Christ’s return?
options: Be diligent to be found in peace, without spot and blameless
Ignore the promise and focus on worldly success
Judge others who do not believe
questions.correctAnswer: Be diligent to be found in peace, without spot and blameless
questions.explanation: Verse 14 instructs believers to actively live in peace and purity, aligning with the call for godliness in verses 11 and 12.

questions.question: A believer is confused about difficult scriptures and false interpretations. What warning does 2 Peter 3 give about this?
options: Some will wrest the scriptures to their own destruction
All scripture is easy to understand and never misinterpreted
Unlearned people will be blessed for their simplicity
False teachers have no impact on believers
questions.correctAnswer: Some will wrest the scriptures to their own destruction
questions.explanation: Verse 16 warns that some who are unlearned and unstable distort scripture, leading to their destruction, highlighting the importance of sound teaching.

questions.question: What practical advice does 2 Peter 3 offer to believers to avoid falling into error?
options: Beware lest you be led away with the error of the wicked and fall from your steadfastness
Ignore false teachings and stay comfortable in your beliefs
Follow the crowd regardless of truth
questions.correctAnswer: Beware lest you be led away with the error of the wicked and fall from your steadfastness
questions.explanation: Verse 17 cautions believers to remain vigilant and steadfast in the truth to avoid being deceived, emphasizing perseverance through trials.

questions.question: How does 2 Peter 3 teach believers to grow spiritually in daily life?
options: Grow in grace and in the knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ
Focus only on external religious rituals
Neglect personal study and rely on others
questions.correctAnswer: Grow in grace and in the knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Verse 18 encourages continual spiritual growth through grace and knowledge of Christ, foundational for effective Christian living.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Peter 3, the heavens and earth have always remained unchanged since creation.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 6 explains that the world of the past perished through water, and verses 7 and 12 speak of future dissolution by fire, showing change over time.

questions.question: True or False: The chapter emphasizes that God’s promise of Christ’s return is slack and unreliable.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 9 clarifies that God is not slack concerning His promise but is patient to allow repentance, showing reliability and faithfulness.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 2 Peter 3:10 says, ‘But the day of the Lord will come as a ______ in the night; in the which the heavens shall pass away with a great noise.’
questions.correctAnswer: thief
questions.explanation: Verse 10 uses the metaphor of a thief to express the unexpected nature of the Lord’s coming, urging readiness and holy living.

questions.question: Based on 2 Peter 3, how should a Christian respond to the coming judgment and destruction of the earth?
options: By living a godly and holy life in anticipation
By ignoring it since it is far away
questions.correctAnswer: By living a godly and holy life in anticipation
questions.explanation: Verses 11, 12, and 14 encourage believers to live godly, holy, and diligent lives while awaiting the day of God, demonstrating practical obedience.

questions.question: What does 2 Peter 3 suggest about the role of apostles and prophets in remembering God’s promises?
options: Believers should be mindful of the words spoken by holy prophets and apostles
Their teachings are obsolete and should be ignored
Only the apostles’ words are important
Prophets were mistaken about the future
questions.correctAnswer: Believers should be mindful of the words spoken by holy prophets and apostles
questions.explanation: Verses 1 and 2 emphasize recalling the teachings of both prophets and apostles, which strengthen faith and obedience.

hard.title: 2 Peter Chapter 3 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Peter Chapter 3.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 3:3, what characterizes the scoffers in the last days?
options: They walk after their own lusts
questions.correctAnswer: They walk after their own lusts
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:3 states that scoffers will come in the last days, walking after their own lusts, indicating selfish and sinful motivations.

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'one day is with the Lord as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day' in 2 Peter 3:8?
options: It emphasizes God's different perception of time compared to humans
It teaches that God is slow to act
It means the earth is exactly 6000 years old
It indicates that time is irrelevant
questions.correctAnswer: It emphasizes God's different perception of time compared to humans
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:8 highlights that God's experience of time is not like human experience, explaining the apparent delay in His promises.

questions.question: In 2 Peter 3:6, what caused the destruction of the world that then was?
questions.correctAnswer: Being overflowed with water
questions.explanation: Verse 6 clearly states that the ancient world perished through being overflowed with water, referencing the flood narrative.

questions.question: 2 Peter 3:9 explains that the Lord is longsuffering. What is the primary reason given for this longsuffering?
options: He is not willing that any should perish but that all should come to repentance
He is slow because He forgets
He wants to prove a point
He is waiting for the perfect time
questions.correctAnswer: He is not willing that any should perish but that all should come to repentance
questions.explanation: This verse reveals God's patience is motivated by His desire for universal repentance and salvation.

questions.question: What imagery does 2 Peter 3:10 use to describe the day of the Lord?
questions.correctAnswer: A thief in the night
questions.explanation: Verse 10 compares the suddenness of the Lord’s coming to a thief in the night, emphasizing unexpectedness and urgency.

questions.question: How does 2 Peter 3:13 describe the new heavens and new earth believers look for?
questions.correctAnswer: Wherein dwelleth righteousness
questions.explanation: This verse specifically mentions righteousness as the defining characteristic of the new creation awaited.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 3:15-16, why might some people misunderstand Paul's epistles?
options: Because they are unlearned and unstable, wrestling the scriptures to their own destruction
questions.correctAnswer: Because they are unlearned and unstable, wrestling the scriptures to their own destruction
questions.explanation: The text highlights that misunderstanding arises from instability and lack of learning, leading to misinterpretation and harm.

questions.question: What exhortation does 2 Peter 3:18 give to believers as a response to these teachings?
options: Grow in grace and in the knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Grow in grace and in the knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Verse 18 encourages spiritual growth and deeper understanding of Jesus as the proper response to the preceding teachings.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Peter 3:7 teaches that the present heavens and earth are reserved for fire on the day of judgment.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 7 explicitly states that the current heavens and earth are kept in store, reserved unto fire for the day of judgment.

questions.question: What literary device is primarily used in 2 Peter 3:10 describing the heavens passing away and elements melting with fervent heat?
questions.correctAnswer: Apocalyptic imagery
questions.explanation: The vivid description of cosmic destruction uses apocalyptic imagery common in prophetic and eschatological literature.

questions.question: In the context of 2 Peter 3, which Old Testament event is alluded to in verses 5-6 regarding the earth and water?
options: The Flood in the time of Noah
The parting of the Red Sea
The crossing of the Jordan River
questions.correctAnswer: The Flood in the time of Noah
questions.explanation: The mention of the world being overflowed with water and perishing alludes to the Noahic flood narrative in Genesis.

questions.question: How does 2 Peter 3:14 instruct believers to live in anticipation of the new heavens and new earth?
options: Be diligent to be found in peace, without spot, and blameless
questions.correctAnswer: Be diligent to be found in peace, without spot, and blameless
questions.explanation: Verse 14 calls for believers to live holy and blameless lives in readiness for Christ's return.

questions.question: 2 Peter 3:2 emphasizes remembrance of whose words?
options: The holy prophets and the apostles of the Lord and Saviour
questions.correctAnswer: The holy prophets and the apostles of the Lord and Saviour
questions.explanation: Verse 2 instructs to remember the words spoken by the holy prophets and apostles, indicating the foundation of Christian teaching.

questions.question: What is the implied theological contrast in 2 Peter 3:4 between the scoffers' view and the apostolic teaching?
options: Scoffers claim all things continue as they were from creation, denying the promised coming
Scoffers affirm the resurrection of the dead
questions.correctAnswer: Scoffers claim all things continue as they were from creation, denying the promised coming
questions.explanation: Verse 4 records scoffers questioning the promise of Christ’s coming, asserting no change since creation, opposing apostolic prophecy.

questions.question: What is the authorial intent behind 2 Peter 3:17's warning to believers?
options: To beware lest they fall from their steadfastness due to the error of the wicked
To dismiss the Old Testament law
questions.correctAnswer: To beware lest they fall from their steadfastness due to the error of the wicked
questions.explanation: Verse 17 warns believers to remain firm in faith and not be led astray by false teaching, reflecting pastoral concern.

theological.title: 2 Peter Chapter 3 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Peter Chapter 3 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 3, what is the purpose of the apostle's second epistle?
options: To stir up pure minds by way of remembrance
To introduce new doctrines unknown before
To rebuke the church for heresies
questions.correctAnswer: To stir up pure minds by way of remembrance
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:1 clearly states that the epistle is written to stir up the pure minds of believers by reminding them of truths previously taught. This aligns with Paul's exhortation in 1 Corinthians 10:11 and Jude 1:5 to remember past teachings for encouragement.

questions.question: Who does 2 Peter 3 say will come in the last days, and what characterizes them?
options: Scoffers walking after their own lusts
False prophets performing signs and wonders
questions.correctAnswer: Scoffers walking after their own lusts
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:3 identifies scoffers who follow their own desires as a hallmark of the last days, echoing warnings in Jude 1:18 and 1 Timothy 4:1 about apostasy and mockers in the end times.

questions.question: What question do the scoffers in 2 Peter 3:4 ask regarding Christ's coming?
options: "Where is the promise of His coming?"
"What is the sign of the end times?"
questions.correctAnswer: "Where is the promise of His coming?"
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:4 records the scoffers asking 'Where is the promise of His coming?' This question challenges the doctrine of Christ's second coming, similar to mockery found in Matthew 24:38-39 and Luke 17:26-30.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 3, how were the heavens and the earth originally formed?
options: By the word of God, with the earth standing out of water and in water
By natural processes over millions of years
By the will of the ancient gods
questions.correctAnswer: By the word of God, with the earth standing out of water and in water
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:5 teaches that the heavens and earth were made by God's word, with the earth existing amidst water, paralleling Genesis 1:1-10 and Psalm 33:6, affirming divine creation.

questions.question: What event caused the destruction of the world 'that then was' according to 2 Peter 3?
options: The world was overflowed with water and perished
It was destroyed by the angels of judgment
questions.correctAnswer: The world was overflowed with water and perished
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:6 states the ancient world was destroyed by a flood, consistent with Genesis 6-9's account of Noah's flood and the judgment of ungodliness by water.

questions.question: How does 2 Peter 3 describe the future judgment of the current heavens and earth?
options: Reserved unto fire against the day of judgment and perdition of ungodly men
Destroyed by a great flood again
questions.correctAnswer: Reserved unto fire against the day of judgment and perdition of ungodly men
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:7 reveals the present heavens and earth are kept for fire judgment, echoing prophetic imagery in Malachi 4:1, Revelation 20:9, and the final fire described in Isaiah 66:15-16.

questions.question: What theological truth about God's perspective on time is taught in 2 Peter 3?
options: One day is with the Lord as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day
God experiences time exactly as humans do
God's timing is irrelevant to His promises
Time cycles endlessly without beginning or end
questions.correctAnswer: One day is with the Lord as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:8 teaches God's perception of time differs from human understanding, emphasizing His eternal nature and patience, consistent with Psalm 90:4 and Isaiah 55:8-9.

questions.question: Why does the Lord delay His promised coming according to 2 Peter 3?
options: Because He is longsuffering, not willing that any should perish but that all should come to repentance
Because the saints are not ready yet
Because the world must be punished first
questions.correctAnswer: Because He is longsuffering, not willing that any should perish but that all should come to repentance
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:9 explains the delay is due to God's patience and desire for all to repent, reflecting 1 Timothy 2:4 and Ezekiel 33:11's affirmations of God's mercy.

questions.question: How will the day of the Lord come, as described in 2 Peter 3?
options: As a thief in the night
With visible signs and trumpet blasts
With the resurrection of the saints
Through a gradual process over centuries
questions.correctAnswer: As a thief in the night
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:10 states the day of the Lord will come unexpectedly, like a thief, which parallels Jesus' teaching in Matthew 24:43 and 1 Thessalonians 5:2 on sudden judgment.

questions.question: What will happen to the elements and the earth on the day of the Lord according to 2 Peter 3?
options: The elements will melt with fervent heat, and the earth and its works will be burned up
The elements will be washed away by water
The earth will be covered in darkness forever
The earth will be divided into two parts
questions.correctAnswer: The elements will melt with fervent heat, and the earth and its works will be burned up
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:10 describes cosmic dissolution by fire, consistent with prophetic imagery in Isaiah 66:15-16 and Revelation 21:1, signifying final purification and judgment.

questions.question: What kind of people does 2 Peter 3 encourage believers to be, in light of the coming judgment?
questions.correctAnswer: Holy in conversation and godliness
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:11 exhorts believers to live holy and godly lives, reflecting Leviticus 11:44 and 1 Timothy 4:7-8 which emphasize sanctification in anticipation of Christ's return.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 3, what are believers looking forward to that involves 'new heavens and a new earth'?
options: The restoration of the old creation
A spiritual kingdom without physical reality
questions.correctAnswer: A dwelling where righteousness dwells
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:13 speaks of new heavens and a new earth where righteousness dwells, echoing Isaiah 65:17-25 and Revelation 21:1-4 about the eternal kingdom of God.

questions.question: What does 2 Peter 3:15 associate the Lord's longsuffering with?
questions.correctAnswer: Salvation
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:15 teaches that the Lord's patience is salvation, showing God's mercy in delaying judgment to allow repentance, consistent with Romans 2:4 and Exodus 34:6.

questions.question: How does 2 Peter 3 describe some interpretations of Paul's epistles?
options: Some things are hard to understand and are twisted by unlearned and unstable to their own destruction
They are straightforward and universally agreed upon
They are irrelevant to Christian living
They are only symbolic and not literal
questions.correctAnswer: Some things are hard to understand and are twisted by unlearned and unstable to their own destruction
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:16 warns that some parts of Paul's letters are difficult and are distorted by those lacking understanding, echoing warnings in 2 Timothy 2:15 and Acts 17:11 about accurate handling of Scripture.

questions.question: What warning does 2 Peter 3 give to believers regarding error?
options: Beware lest you be led away with the error of the wicked and fall from your steadfastness
Accept all teachings as equally valid
questions.correctAnswer: Beware lest you be led away with the error of the wicked and fall from your steadfastness
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 3:17 cautions believers to be vigilant against deception that could cause them to fall away, comparable to 1 Timothy 4:1-2 and Hebrews 3:12.
